dict.string: A request meaning Let me know that you have received my message.
Acknowledge
A request meaning Tell me what you plan to do.
Advise Intentions
The term used by ATC for yes.
Affirmative
A statement meaning that adherence to previously imposed altitude restriction is no longer required during a climb or descent.
Altitude Restrictions Are Cancelled
A phrase used to prefix a message of noncontrol information when it is relayed to an aircraft by other than an air traffic controller.
Atc Advises
A phrase used to prefix an ATC clearance when it is relayed to an aircraft by other than an air traffic controller.
Atc Clears
A phrase used to prefix an ATC request when it is relayed to an aircraft by other than an air traffic controller.
Atc Requests
The phrase used to indicate that a radio transmission has been distorted or interrupted due to multiple simultaneous radio transmissions.
Blocked
A phrase used by ATC to inform the pilot that he must circle to land because the runway in use is other than the runway aligned with the instrument approach procedure.
Circle To Runway (Runway Number)
A phrase used by ATC to advise an aircraft that the departure clearance is automatically cancelled if takeoff is not made prior to a specific time.
Clearance Void If Not Off By (Time)
ATC authorization for an aircraft to execute a specific instrument approach to an airport.
Cleared For (Type Of) Approach
ATC authorization for an aircraft to execute any standard or special instrument approach for that airport.
Cleared For Approach
ATC authorization for an aircraft to depart.
Cleared For Takeoff
ATC authorization for an aircraft to make a touch-and-go, low approach, missed approach, stop-and-go, or full-stop landing at the discretion of the pilot.
Cleared For The Option
ATC authorization aircraft to make intermediate stops at specified airports without refilling a flight plan while enroute to the clearance limit.
Cleared Through
ATC authorization for an aircraft to land.
Cleared To Land
ATC authorization for an aircraft to climb to VFR conditions within a control zone when the only weather limitation is restricted visibility.
Climb To Vfr
A phrase used by ATC when a specific altitude restriction at a specified fix is required.
Cross (Fix) At (Altitude)
A phrase used by ATC when an altitude restriction at a specified fix is required.
Cross (Fix) At Or Above (Altitude)
A phrase used by ATC when a maximum crossing altitude at a specific fix is required.
Cross (Fix) At Or Below (Altitude)
A phrase used by ATC to inform a pilot when an accurate estimate of the delay time and the reason for the delay cannot immediately be determined.
Delay Indefinite (Reason, If Known) Expect Further Clearance Time

An instruction issued to a pilot on an instrument approach, directing him to continue inbound to the missed-approach point and then to execute the missed-approach point and then to execute the missed-approach procedure, as described on the Instrument Approach Procedure Chart or as previously assigned by ACT.
Execute Missed Approach
A portion of an instrument departure clearance, to provide a pilot with an altitude to be used in the event of two-way radio communication failure.
Expect (Altitude) At (Time) Or (Fix)
The time an operator can expect a gate release.
Expect Departure Clearance (Time)
The time a pilot can expect to receive clearance beyond a clearance limit.
Expect Further Clearance (Time)
This phrase is used by air traffic controllers to inform a pilot of the routing he may expect if any part of the route beyond a short range clearance limit differs from that filed.
Expect Further Clearances Via (Airways, Routes, Or Fixes)
A warning used by air traffic controllers when prompt compliance is required in order to avoid the development of an imminent situation.
Expedite
A call-sign prefix used by FAA aircraft engaged inspection/certification of navigational aids and flight procedures.
Flight Check
Instructions issued by ATC to a pilot directing him to turn to and continue in a specific compass direction.
Fly HeadingDegrees
A phrase used by either pilots or controllers that relates to the fuel remaining on board until actual fuel exhaustion.
Fuel Remaining
